alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued April 01 at 5:14AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...THE FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER IN SALT LAKE CITY HAS ISSUED A BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING WHICH IS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MDT SATURDAY TO 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area is HIGH with dangerous avalanche conditions. * WHERE...The mountains of northern Utah including the Wasatch Range, Bear River Range, and the Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...In effect from 6 am MDT today to 6 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Heavy snowfall and strong winds have created dangerous avalanche conditions in the backcountry. Both human triggered and natural avalanches are likely. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Stay off of and out from under slopes steeper than 30 degrees. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Stay off of and out from under slopes steeper than 30 degrees. Backcountry travelers should consult www.utahavalanchecenter.org or call 1-888-999-4019 for more detailed information. This Warning does not apply to ski areas where avalanche hazard reduction measures are performed.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains
